moves.1. e4 d5 2. Nc3: 2.Nc3? is a totally weak move against the Scandinavian (centre counter) Defence. Better is 2.exd5, the Scandinavian Defence (Lasker Variation).
moves.2... d4 3. Nce2 e5: This is why. My knight is blocking the Bishop's and the Queen's diagonals.
moves.4. Nf3 Nc6: Slow developement begins with the knights coming out at each other. My knights are in a totally ill-logical position. It is right now worthwhile to lose them.
moves.5. c3 d3: A not-so-simple mistake by black. Only moving pawns may not be a problem now, but it will become a problem later.
moves.8. Nxe5 Nxe5: I was waiting for black to make another mistake.
moves.9. Qb5+ Qd7 10. Qxe5+ Be7: Black is starting to drown in hot water.
moves.11. f3 f6 12. Qf4: A critical threat to the bishop.
moves.12... h5: A totally ill-logical move by black. This costs black two more points.
moves.13. fxg4 hxg4 14. h3: Not  the best move by me, but it can be helpful.
moves.16. Nxe7+ Nxe7 17. Qxf6 a5: This move is a blunder of nothing.
moves.18. Qg5 Rh5 19. Qf4 gxh3: Black's bad decision slowly leads to a loss.
moves.20. gxh3 a4 21. b3 b5 22. c4 bxc4: Black may be winning by defence, but, it has a disadvantage: it's own offence.
moves.23. Ba3 c3 24. dxc3 Rc5: 24. Rc5?? trashes the rook and loses offence and defence.
moves.25. Bxc5 d2+: Come on black, you can do better than this! If you think that I'd fall for 26. Qxd2?? or Ke2?!, you would forget about Kd1!
moves.26. Kd1 a3: Another trapped pawn, and an almost entirely open field. My rampage begins with this weak move.
moves.27. Bxe7: An excellent bishop sacrifice. 27.Bxe7!! makes up for all of my mistakes.
moves.28. Qg4+ Rd7 29. Qxg6 Qxe4: Thanks for the free queen, black! This lazy blunder gets my queen in the right position.
moves.30. Qxe4 Kd8 31. Qh4+ Kc8 32. Ba6+ Kb8 3: Black resigned for this forced mate finishes off black. 33...Ka8 or 33...Ka7 34.Qb7#. This mate wriggles black's king out of the rook-pawn security.
